data.title: Taskwarrior: The most underrated open-source Task manager
data.meta_description:
What is Taskwarrior?

Taskwarrior is an open-source, free to-do/ task lists manager that works from command-line as a terminal application.

Taskwarrior first release was on 3 June 2008, by Paul Beckingham, as it gained popularity over time, it gets an active open-source developer community that keeps it up to date.

GitLight: Brings GitHub and Gitlab Notifications to Your Desktop

GitLight is a free and open-source project that is built on top of Tauri, and Svelte to enable you get all your Git notifications in one place. Advanced Youtube Client for Windows: Download Social Media Videos for Free from YouTube, Facebook, Instagram and More.

AYC is a highly responsive, no nonsense, easy to use, fast video downloader from the text based era. Verve is an amazing macOS Launcher Built with Web Technologies

Verve is a lightweight and blazingly fast launcher for accessing and opening applications, files and documents. It serves as a replacement for popular tools such as Spotlight, Raycast, and Alfred, and is written in the Rust programming language using the Tauri Framework. Marta is the Best Free File Manager for macOS

Enter Marta, a dual-pane file manager that aims to revolutionize the way you navigate your files and directories.
